docs.title: Patching GNOME extensions
docs.text:
The entrypoint for a patch is extensionOverrides.nix. The file also provides many good examples to tackle common issues.

You probably want one of the replacement functions. Schema issues need a few extra lines.

Older reference examples:

  • NixOS/nixpkgs#233642 (Old PR, use replaceVars instead)
  • https://github.com/NixOS/nixpkgs/blob/7bb8f05f12ca3cff9da72b56caa2f7472d5732bc/pkgs/desktops/gnome-3/extensions/gsconnect/default.nix#L21
  • https://nixos.org/manual/nixpkgs/stable/#ssec-gnome-common-issues-unwrappable-package-gsettings-c

docs.text: Use dejsonlz4 to extract your current settings, and tweak it to fit home-manager's programs.firefox.profiles.<name>.search

docs.title: ZSH is slow to start
docs.text:
When using enable = true in both nixpkgs and home-manager zsh slows down a bunch due to duplicate calls to compinit. In my case I just disable the home-manager option.
